chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)
Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas B. Knitter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Electronic File scanned by clerk KB.
Electronic file verified by clerk SDS.
Probation Revoked - Sentenced to Co. Jail/HOC on 05/24/19
Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.

(Cases called at 1:35 PM - 14CF1022, 17CM721, 18CF887, 18CM6, 18CM182, 19CF204)
Defendant Nicholas B. Knitter appears in custody with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Deputy District Attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State outlines agreement for the Court.  Defense has review probation revocation packet in 14CF1022- no corrections to make on the record.  Court orders 1 year in jail, with Huber, on 14CF1022, concurrent to 16CF454 and 16CF531 (with 197 days credit).  Any unpaid financial obligations in that case reduced to a civil judgment.  Defendant pleads No Contest to 17CM721 Count 6: Possession of a Controlled Substance (Repeater); 18CM6 Count 7: Carrying a Concealed Knife (Repeater); 18CM182 Count 1: Retail Theft (Party to a Crime, Repeater); 19CF204 Count 1: Delivery of Methamphetamine (Repeater, 2nd+ Offense, On or Near a Park), Count 7: Delivery of Methamphetamine (Repeater, 2nd+ Offense), Count 8: Felony Bail Jumping (Repeater).  Defendant advised of the elements and maximum possible penalties of the charges to which he has pled.  Defendant acknowledges basis for repeater enhancer.  Defendant advised of his Constitutional rights.  Court accepts pleas and finds Defendant guilty.  Remaining charges, and all of 18CF887, are dismissed and read in.  State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Counsel make additional comments regarding agreement.  As to 17CM721 and 18CM6, Court orders court costs and DNA sample and surcharge.  As to 18CM182 and 19CF204, Court withholds sentence and orders 4 years of probation on 19CF204 and 1 year on 18CM182 with the following conditions:  6 months of jail (on Count 1 in 19CF204), with Huber, stayed pending further order of the Court.  Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with any Target stores, A.T., D.H., A.C., T.S., D.D., S.M., or any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.  Pay restitution (in 18CM182) in an amount of $249.98 + 10% surcharge and any other amount to be determined.  Comply with any conditions/programming recommended by agent.  $160 in West Central Drug Task Force buy money in 19CF204.  No credit if revoked from probation.
Notice of Hearing - Per USPS - Return to Sender - JA sent documentation to defendant's attorney.
SPD Appointment - Attorney Robert Thorson
SPD Appointment - Attorney Robert Thorson
